medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypertension and associated symptoms including morning headaches, limb paresthesia, cramps, palpitations, and tetanic convulsions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At age 13, the patient was investigated for hypertension. Symptoms include morning headaches, limb paresthesia, cramps, and tetanic convulsions. The previous duration and specific intensity of hypertension are not detailed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension diagnosed at age 13. No prior surgeries or chronic illnesses specified.
medical_history.family_history: Father and paternal grandfather had hypertension; no known hypertension in maternal relatives.
